summary.para: Creates a device that uses Direct3D 11 functionality in Direct3D 12, specifying a pre-existing Direct3D 12 device to use for Direct3D 11 interop.

param.name: pDevice
param.para: Type: IUnknown*
Specifies a pre-existing Direct3D 12 device to use for Direct3D 11 interop. May not be NULL.

param.name: Flags
param.para: Type: UINT

One or more bitwise OR'd flags from . These are the same flags as those used by . Specifies which runtime layers to enable. Flags must be compatible with device flags, and its NodeMask must be a subset of the NodeMask provided to the present API.

param.name: pFeatureLevels
param.para: Type: const D3D_FEATURE_LEVEL*
An array of any of the following:

The first feature level that is less than or equal to the Direct3D 12 device's feature level will be used to perform Direct3D 11 validation. Creation will fail if no acceptable feature levels are provided. Providing NULL will default to the Direct3D 12 device's feature level.

param.name: FeatureLevels
param.para: Type: UINT
The size of (that is, the number of elements in) the pFeatureLevels array.

param.name: ppCommandQueues
param.para: Type: IUnknown* const *
An array of unique queues for D3D11On12 to use. The queues must be of the 3D command queue type.

param.name: NumQueues
param.para: Type: UINT
The size of (that is, the number of elements in) the ppCommandQueues array.

param.name: NodeMask
param.para: Type: UINT
Which node of the Direct3D 12 device to use. Only 1 bit may be set.

param.name: ppDevice
param.para: Type: ID3D11Device**
Pointer to the returned . May be NULL.

param.name: ppImmediateContext
param.para: Type: ID3D11DeviceContext**
A pointer to the returned . May be NULL.

param.name: pChosenFeatureLevel
param.para: Type: D3D_FEATURE_LEVEL*
A pointer to the returned feature level. May be NULL.

returns.para: This method returns one of the Direct3D 12 Return Codes that are documented for .

This method returns DXGI_ERROR_SDK_COMPONENT_MISSING if you specify in Flags and the incorrect version of the debug layer is installed on your computer. Install the latest Windows SDK to get the correct version.

remarks.para: The function signature PFN_D3D11ON12_CREATE_DEVICE is provided as a typedef, so that you can use dynamic linking techniques () instead of statically linking.
